content: I don’t remember growing up with a specific distaste for meat. During my childhood I certainly ate toy-laced kid’s meals and gnawed on ribs at more than one family barbecue. Because like many of us, I was raised to eat what was put in front of me and rarely questioned it — except for beef stew of course… and anything visibly healthy or anything I recognized as inedible or otherwise fatal if swallowed (meatloaf, cottage cheese, raisins, Brussels sprouts*).
